title: Getting Ready to Launch
body: Should you exchange your money to liras before you depart? Should you stock up on a heap of traveler’s checks? Do you need to alert your bank to your plans? These questions are just some that must be answered before you head out to catch your flight. In this lesson, we’ll tackle the financial pre-departure steps you should take in order to avoid snags while abroad. Let’s get started.

_transcript.inlineTranscriptBody: Exchange rates vary depending on the institution. However, currency exchange locations, called “dövis,” are abundant and easily found within Turkey, and they also offer lower exchange rates than you will find at a domestic bank. For this reason, it’s wise to exchange a small amount of cash before departure to cover your expenses for a day or two but convert the rest after you arrive.

title: Currency Exchange
body: Exchange rates vary depending on the institution. However, currency exchange locations, called “dövis,” are abundant and easily found within Turkey, and they also offer lower exchange rates than you will find at a domestic bank. For this reason, it’s wise to exchange a small amount of cash before departure to cover your expenses for a day or two but convert the rest after you arrive.

title: Money Option Fees
body: Which of the following money options won’t incur fees when used in Turkey?

_items.title: Incorrect
_items.feedback: Prepaid travel money cards impose lots of fees, from loading and reloading to inactivity and ATM withdrawals.
Correct! Travel debit cards do not charge fees for purchases anywhere Visa or Mastercard are accepted, and the Citibank Plus debit card waives fees for withdrawing cash at ATMs within Turkey.

_items.title: Incorrect
_items.feedback: Almost, but not quite. Travel credit cards charge fees for cash advances.

_items.title: Incorrect
_items.feedback: Unfortunately, traveler’s checks charge fees for both purchasing and cashing.

_feedback.title: Correct
_feedback.correct: Correct! Travel debit cards do not charge fees for purchases anywhere Visa or Mastercard are accepted, and the Citibank Plus debit card waives fees for withdrawing cash at ATMs within Turkey.

title: The Perfect Gift
body: It’s a beautiful day, and you’ve just arrived at Istanbul’s famous Grand Bazaar. You’ve already pulled out cash from an ATM and are ready to indulge in a shopping extravaganza. It’s not long before you fall in love with an exquisite scarf that has your mother’s name written all over it. You must have it! When the shopkeeper approaches you, be prepared to bargain. This is customary and expected. Good luck!

title: Lesson Summary
body:
So, now you know what to do before you leave. You know to call your banks before and alert them to your plans. You know to set-up automatic bill-pay in your absence, get good travel insurance, and find out what your cell service options are.

For a complete pre-departure checklist, visit the module resources where you can print a copy if you’d like. Next up, it’s time to discuss what will happen once you land!

Please select Exit Lesson.
